description: Use non-linear least squares to fit a model function `y = f(x, parameters)` to data.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: A labeled array of numbers. The array labels are the values for `x` (independent variable where the data is measured) and the array elements are the values for `y` (dependent data).

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The model function. It must take the independent variable `x` as the first argument and the parameters to fit as array through the second argument.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The value for the independent variable `x`.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the model function, at least one parameter required.

returns.description: The computed value `y` value for the given independent variable `x` and the parameters.

parameters.name: ignore_invalid
parameters.description: By default, the process throws an `InvalidValues` exception if invalid values are encountered. Invalid values are finite numbers (see also ``is_valid()``). Enabling this parameter ignores invalid values, but may lead to nonsensical results if invalid values are present.

returns.description: An array with the optimal values for the parameters.

InvalidValues.message: At least one of the values is not a finite number.
